snippet: A Renaissance drawing from one of the most famous collections in Britain sold at Sotheby’s in London on Wednesday night for $47.8 million, slightly more than twice its high $23.8 million estimate.
abstract: A Renaissance drawing from one of the most famous collections in Britain sold at Sotheby’s in London on Wednesday night for $47.8 million, slightly more than twice its high $23.8 million estimate.
lead_paragraph: A Renaissance drawing from one of the most famous collections in Britain sold at Sotheby’s in London on Wednesday night for $47.8 million, slightly more than twice its high $23.8 million estimate.
